intro: Verbesina angustissima, commonly known as narrowleaf beggar-ticks, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in clusters, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Verbesina angustissima is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun.
